synopsis.text:
The popular smartphone game, 'Phantom of the Kill', is set to unveil a new dimension with a 15-minute anime concept film. Celebrating its first anniversary, the game's producer, Jun Imaizumi, announced this exciting project among several others during a Niconico live broadcast. The anime will be skillfully directed by Naoyoshi Shiotani, known for his work on Psycho-Pass and Blood-C: The Last Dark, at Production I.G.

The game unfolds as a strategy drama RPG, featuring enigmatic female characters who bear the names of legendary weapons, such as 'Masamune'. These characters are on a relentless quest to recover their misplaced memories. Players are invited to collect an array of characters and weapons, leading them into dungeon battles that require tactical turn-based combat.

The upcoming anime concept film promises to capture the essence of the game, offering fans a fresh perspective on their beloved characters and their intriguing journey.
synopsis.author: mistral.mistral-large-2402-v1:0
